alert.note: Alert for Frenchman Basin; Loess Plains (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 13 at 2:12PM CDT until October 13 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 210 AND 219... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM CDT FRIDAY FOR WIND AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 210 AND 219... The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon to 8 PM CDT Friday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zone 210 and 219. * TIMING...Red Flag Warning Thursday afternoon and evening. Red Flag Warning Friday afternoon and evening. * WINDS...Northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Low to mid 60s today. Mid to upper 70s Friday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly andbe very difficult to control.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
